intro: Ranunculus comatus, commonly known as the hairy buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and bright yellow flowers with numerous petals. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky soils, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Ranunculus comatus is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, known for its showy blooms and ecological importance in its native habitats.
